page.title: 14TINKER PROBLEM
page.content: The question of where itinerants should be allowed to camp has caused friction in many areas.Some councils have set up special permanent sites but local people tend to oppose the practice.Baginton is no exeption where fifteen {traveller's }caravans have been parked near the airport defying a High Court writ to move.Local people complain that rubbish dumping is making the area an eyesore. The issue has become{political}as the labour run West Midlands Council is sending four councillors and two officers to Dublin to find out why Irish tinkers come to Britain. The West Midlands Tory leader Alan Hope is opposing the scheme as 'insane' as the question can be put to Irish tinkers already here and save the ratepayers Â£2,000.
